GeneralTransform3DCollection Class

Definition

Represents an ordered collection of GeneralTransform3D objects.

In this Article

public sealed class GeneralTransform3DCollection : System.Windows.Media.Animation.Animatable, System.Collections.Generic.ICollection<System.Windows.Media.Media3D.GeneralTransform3D>, System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable<System.Windows.Media.Media3D.GeneralTransform3D>, System.Collections.Generic.IList<System.Windows.Media.Media3D.GeneralTransform3D>, System.Collections.IList

Remarks

Except as noted, members of this class behave exactly as described by the IList<T>, ICollection<T>, and IEnumerable<T> documentation.

Freezable Features: Because it inherits from the Freezable class, the GeneralTransform3DCollection class provides several special features: GeneralTransform3DCollection objects can be declared as , shared among multiple objects, made read-only to improve performance, cloned, and made thread safe. For more information about the different features provided by Freezable objects, see Freezable Objects Overview.

GeneralTransform3DCollection is introduced in the .NET Framework version 3.5. For more information, see Versions and Dependencies.

XAML Implicit Collection Usage

<object>  
  <object.property>  
    oneOrMoreGeneralTransform3DObjectElements  
  </object.property>  
</object>

XAML Values

oneOrMoreGeneralTransform3DObjectElements
One or more GeneralTransform3D objects, declared using object element syntax.

Unlike typical implementations of [IList<T>.Item<xref:System.Collections.Generic.IList%601.Item%2A?displayProperty=fullName>, this implementation throws an ArgumentException if you attempt to insert a null reference.

Item is introduced in the .NET Framework version 3.5. For more information, see Versions and Dependencies.

Clone()

Creates a modifiable clone of this collection, making deep copies of this object's values.

public System.Windows.Media.Media3D.GeneralTransform3DCollection Clone ();
Returns
GeneralTransform3DCollection

A modifiable clone of the current object. The cloned object's stem.Windows.Freezable.IsFrozen* property is false even if the source's stem.Windows.Freezable.IsFrozen* property is true.

Remarks

This method is used to produce modifiable copies of frozen Freezable objects (or any Freezable object). For convenience, this method shadows the inherited version with a strongly typed implementation.

For more information, see Clone.

When copying dependency properties, this method copies resource references and data bindings (they might no longer resolve) but not animations or their current values.

Clone is introduced in the .NET Framework version 3.5. For more information, see Versions and Dependencies.
